get.description: Ping check. Endpoint required for SageMaker

post.description: Ping check. Endpoint required for SageMaker

schema.title: Response 200 Scale Elastic Ep Scale Elastic Ep Post

post.description: For SageMaker, routes requests based on the request type.

ActionDragPath.title: ActionDragPath
ActionDragPath.description: An x/y coordinate pair, e.g. `{ x: 100, y: 200 }`.

ActionFind.title: ActionFind
ActionFind.description: Action type "find": Searches for a pattern within a loaded page.

ActionKeypress.title: ActionKeypress
ActionKeypress.description: A collection of keypresses the model would like to perform.

ActionOpenPage.title: ActionOpenPage
ActionOpenPage.description: Action type "open_page" - Opens a specific URL from search results.

ActionSearch.title: ActionSearch
ActionSearch.description: Action type "search" - Performs a web search query.

ActionSearchSource.title: ActionSearchSource
ActionSearchSource.description: A source used in the search.

ActionType.title: ActionType
ActionType.description: An action to type in text.

AnnotationContainerFileCitation.title: AnnotationContainerFileCitation
AnnotationContainerFileCitation.description: A citation for a container file used to generate a model response.

AnnotationURLCitation.title: AnnotationURLCitation
AnnotationURLCitation.description: A citation for a web resource used to generate a model response.

ApplyPatchCall.title: ApplyPatchCall
ApplyPatchCall.description: A tool call representing a request to create, delete, or update files using diff patches.

ApplyPatchCallOperationCreateFile.title: ApplyPatchCallOperationCreateFile
ApplyPatchCallOperationCreateFile.description: Instruction for creating a new file via the apply_patch tool.

ApplyPatchCallOperationDeleteFile.title: ApplyPatchCallOperationDeleteFile
ApplyPatchCallOperationDeleteFile.description: Instruction for deleting an existing file via the apply_patch tool.

ApplyPatchCallOperationUpdateFile.title: ApplyPatchCallOperationUpdateFile
ApplyPatchCallOperationUpdateFile.description: Instruction for updating an existing file via the apply_patch tool.

ApplyPatchCallOutput.title: ApplyPatchCallOutput
ApplyPatchCallOutput.description: The streamed output emitted by an apply patch tool call.

ApplyPatchTool.title: ApplyPatchTool
ApplyPatchTool.description: Allows the assistant to create, delete, or update files using unified diffs.

Audio.title: Audio
Audio.description:
Data about a previous audio response from the model.
[Learn more](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/audio).

ChatCompletionAssistantMessageParam.title: ChatCompletionAssistantMessageParam
ChatCompletionAssistantMessageParam.description: Messages sent by the model in response to user messages.

ChatCompletionDeveloperMessageParam.title: ChatCompletionDeveloperMessageParam
ChatCompletionDeveloperMessageParam.description:
Developer-provided instructions that the model should follow, regardless of
messages sent by the user. With o1 models and newer, `developer` messages
replace the previous `system` messages.

ChatCompletionMessageCustomToolCallParam.title: ChatCompletionMessageCustomToolCallParam
ChatCompletionMessageCustomToolCallParam.description: A call to a custom tool created by the model.

ChatCompletionMessageFunctionToolCallPar.title: ChatCompletionMessageFunctionToolCallParam
ChatCompletionMessageFunctionToolCallPar.description: A call to a function tool created by the model.

echo.title: Echo
echo.description: If true, the new message will be prepended with the last message if they belong to the same role.

add_generation_prompt.title: Add Generation Prompt
add_generation_prompt.description: If true, the generation prompt will be added to the chat template. This is a parameter used by chat template in tokenizer config of the model.

continue_final_message.title: Continue Final Message
continue_final_message.description: If this is set, the chat will be formatted so that the final message in the chat is open-ended, without any EOS tokens. The model will continue this message rather than starting a new one. This allows you to "prefill" part of the model's response for it. Cannot be used at the same time as `add_generation_prompt`.

add_special_tokens.title: Add Special Tokens
add_special_tokens.description: If true, special tokens (e.g. BOS) will be added to the prompt on top of what is added by the chat template. For most models, the chat template takes care of adding the special tokens so this should be set to false (as is the default).

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: A list of dicts representing documents that will be accessible to the model if it is performing RAG (retrieval-augmented generation). If the template does not support RAG, this argument will have no effect. We recommend that each document should be a dict containing "title" and "text" keys.

chat_template.title: Chat Template
chat_template.description: A Jinja template to use for this conversion. As of transformers v4.44, default chat template is no longer allowed, so you must provide a chat template if the tokenizer does not define one.

chat_template_kwargs.title: Chat Template Kwargs
chat_template_kwargs.description: Additional keyword args to pass to the template renderer. Will be accessible by the chat template.

mm_processor_kwargs.title: Mm Processor Kwargs
mm_processor_kwargs.description: Additional kwargs to pass to the HF processor.

guided_json.title: Guided Json
guided_json.description: `guided_json` is deprecated. This will be removed in v0.12.0 or v1.0.0, whichever is soonest. Please pass `json` to `structured_outputs` instead.

guided_regex.title: Guided Regex
guided_regex.description: `guided_regex` is deprecated. This will be removed in v0.12.0 or v1.0.0, whichever is soonest. Please pass `regex` to `structured_outputs` instead.

guided_choice.title: Guided Choice
guided_choice.description: `guided_choice` is deprecated. This will be removed in v0.12.0 or v1.0.0, whichever is soonest. Please pass `choice` to `structured_outputs` instead.

guided_grammar.title: Guided Grammar
guided_grammar.description: `guided_grammar` is deprecated. This will be removed in v0.12.0 or v1.0.0, whichever is soonest. Please pass `grammar` to `structured_outputs` instead.

structural_tag.title: Structural Tag
structural_tag.description: `structural_tag` is deprecated. This will be removed in v0.12.0 or v1.0.0, whichever is soonest. Please pass `structural_tag` to `structured_outputs` instead.

guided_decoding_backend.title: Guided Decoding Backend
guided_decoding_backend.description: `guided_decoding_backend` is deprecated. This will be removed in v0.12.0 or v1.0.0, whichever is soonest. Please remove it from your request.

guided_whitespace_pattern.title: Guided Whitespace Pattern
guided_whitespace_pattern.description: `guided_whitespace_pattern` is deprecated. This will be removed in v0.12.0 or v1.0.0, whichever is soonest. Please pass `whitespace_pattern` to `structured_outputs` instead.

priority.title: Priority
priority.description: The priority of the request (lower means earlier handling; default: 0). Any priority other than 0 will raise an error if the served model does not use priority scheduling.

request_id.title: Request Id
request_id.description: The request_id related to this request. If the caller does not set it, a random_uuid will be generated. This id is used through out the inference process and return in response.

logits_processors.title: Logits Processors
logits_processors.description: A list of either qualified names of logits processors, or constructor objects, to apply when sampling. A constructor is a JSON object with a required 'qualname' field specifying the qualified name of the processor class/factory, and optional 'args' and 'kwargs' fields containing positional and keyword arguments. For example: {'qualname': 'my_module.MyLogitsProcessor', 'args': [1, 2], 'kwargs': {'param': 'value'}}.

return_tokens_as_token_ids.title: Return Tokens As Token Ids
return_tokens_as_token_ids.description: If specified with 'logprobs', tokens are represented  as strings of the form 'token_id:{token_id}' so that tokens that are not JSON-encodable can be identified.

return_token_ids.title: Return Token Ids
return_token_ids.description: If specified, the result will include token IDs alongside the generated text. In streaming mode, prompt_token_ids is included only in the first chunk, and token_ids contains the delta tokens for each chunk. This is useful for debugging or when you need to map generated text back to input tokens.

cache_salt.title: Cache Salt
cache_salt.description: If specified, the prefix cache will be salted with the provided string to prevent an attacker to guess prompts in multi-user environments. The salt should be random, protected from access by 3rd parties, and long enough to be unpredictable (e.g., 43 characters base64-encoded, corresponding to 256 bit). Not supported by vLLM engine V0.

kv_transfer_params.title: Kv Transfer Params
kv_transfer_params.description: KVTransfer parameters used for disaggregated serving.

vllm_xargs.title: Vllm Xargs
vllm_xargs.description: Additional request parameters with string or numeric values, used by custom extensions.

ChatCompletionSystemMessageParam.title: ChatCompletionSystemMessageParam
ChatCompletionSystemMessageParam.description:
Developer-provided instructions that the model should follow, regardless of
messages sent by the user. With o1 models and newer, use `developer` messages
for this purpose instead.

ChatCompletionUserMessageParam.title: ChatCompletionUserMessageParam
ChatCompletionUserMessageParam.description:
Messages sent by an end user, containing prompts or additional context
information.

priority.title: Priority
priority.description: The priority of the request (lower means earlier handling; default: 0). Any priority other than 0 will raise an error if the served model does not use priority scheduling.

CodeInterpreter.title: CodeInterpreter
CodeInterpreter.description: A tool that runs Python code to help generate a response to a prompt.

CodeInterpreterContainerCodeInterpreterT.title: CodeInterpreterContainerCodeInterpreterToolAuto
CodeInterpreterContainerCodeInterpreterT.description:
Configuration for a code interpreter container.

Optionally specify the IDs of the files to run the code on.

ComparisonFilter.title: ComparisonFilter
ComparisonFilter.description: A filter used to compare a specified attribute key to a given value using a defined comparison operation.

add_special_tokens.title: Add Special Tokens
add_special_tokens.description: If true (the default), special tokens (e.g. BOS) will be added to the prompt.

response_format.title: Response Format
response_format.description: Similar to chat completion, this parameter specifies the format of output. Only {'type': 'json_object'}, {'type': 'json_schema'}, {'type': 'structural_tag'}, or {'type': 'text' } is supported.

guided_json.title: Guided Json
guided_json.description: `guided_json` is deprecated. This will be removed in v0.12.0 or v1.0.0, whichever is soonest. Please pass `json` to `structured_outputs` instead.

guided_regex.title: Guided Regex
guided_regex.description: `guided_regex` is deprecated. This will be removed in v0.12.0 or v1.0.0, whichever is soonest. Please pass `regex` to `structured_outputs` instead.

guided_choice.title: Guided Choice
guided_choice.description: `guided_choice` is deprecated. This will be removed in v0.12.0 or v1.0.0, whichever is soonest. Please pass `choice` to `structured_outputs` instead.

guided_grammar.title: Guided Grammar
guided_grammar.description: `guided_grammar` is deprecated. This will be removed in v0.12.0 or v1.0.0, whichever is soonest. Please pass `grammar` to `structured_outputs` instead.

guided_decoding_backend.title: Guided Decoding Backend
guided_decoding_backend.description: `guided_decoding_backend` is deprecated. This will be removed in v0.12.0 or v1.0.0, whichever is soonest. Please remove it from your request.

guided_whitespace_pattern.title: Guided Whitespace Pattern
guided_whitespace_pattern.description: `guided_whitespace_pattern` is deprecated. This will be removed in v0.12.0 or v1.0.0, whichever is soonest. Please pass `whitespace_pattern` to `structured_outputs` instead.

return_token_ids.title: Return Token Ids
return_token_ids.description: If specified, the result will include token IDs alongside the generated text. In streaming mode, prompt_token_ids is included only in the first chunk, and token_ids contains the delta tokens for each chunk. This is useful for debugging or when you need to map generated text back to input tokens.

cache_salt.description: If specified, the prefix cache will be salted with the provided string to prevent an attacker to guess prompts in multi-user environments. The salt should be random, protected from access by 3rd parties, and long enough to be unpredictable (e.g., 43 characters base64-encoded, corresponding to 256 bit). Not supported by vLLM engine V0.

kv_transfer_params.description: KVTransfer parameters used for disaggregated serving.

vllm_xargs.description: Additional request parameters with string or numeric values, used by custom extensions.

CustomChatCompletionMessageParam.title: CustomChatCompletionMessageParam
CustomChatCompletionMessageParam.description: Enables custom roles in the Chat Completion API.

CustomThinkCompletionContentParam.title: CustomThinkCompletionContentParam
CustomThinkCompletionContentParam.description:
A Think Completion Content Param that accepts a plain text and a boolean.

Example:
{
    "thinking": "I am thinking about the answer",
    "closed": True,
    "type": "thinking"
}

CustomTool.title: CustomTool
CustomTool.description:
A custom tool that processes input using a specified format.

Learn more about   [custom tools](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/function-calling#custom-tools)

EasyInputMessageParam.title: EasyInputMessageParam
EasyInputMessageParam.description:
A message input to the model with a role indicating instruction following
hierarchy. Instructions given with the `developer` or `system` role take
precedence over instructions given with the `user` role. Messages with the
`assistant` role are presumed to have been generated by the model in previous
interactions.

add_generation_prompt.title: Add Generation Prompt
add_generation_prompt.description: If true, the generation prompt will be added to the chat template. This is a parameter used by chat template in tokenizer config of the model.

add_special_tokens.title: Add Special Tokens
add_special_tokens.description: If true, special tokens (e.g. BOS) will be added to the prompt on top of what is added by the chat template. For most models, the chat template takes care of adding the special tokens so this should be set to false (as is the default).

chat_template.title: Chat Template
chat_template.description: A Jinja template to use for this conversion. As of transformers v4.44, default chat template is no longer allowed, so you must provide a chat template if the tokenizer does not define one.

chat_template_kwargs.description: Additional keyword args to pass to the template renderer. Will be accessible by the chat template.

mm_processor_kwargs.title: Mm Processor Kwargs
mm_processor_kwargs.description: Additional kwargs to pass to the HF processor.

priority.description: The priority of the request (lower means earlier handling; default: 0). Any priority other than 0 will raise an error if the served model does not use priority scheduling.

request_id.description: The request_id related to this request. If the caller does not set it, a random_uuid will be generated. This id is used through out the inference process and return in response.

add_special_tokens.description: If true (the default), special tokens (e.g. BOS) will be added to the prompt.

request_id.title: Request Id

FileSearchTool.title: FileSearchTool
FileSearchTool.description:
A tool that searches for relevant content from uploaded files.

Learn more about the [file search tool](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools-file-search).

Function.title: Function
Function.description: The function that the model called.

FunctionCall.title: FunctionCall
FunctionCall.description:
Deprecated and replaced by `tool_calls`.

The name and arguments of a function that should be called, as generated by the model.

FunctionCallOutput.title: FunctionCallOutput
FunctionCallOutput.description: The output of a function tool call.

FunctionShellTool.title: FunctionShellTool
FunctionShellTool.description: A tool that allows the model to execute shell commands.

FunctionTool.title: FunctionTool
FunctionTool.description:
Defines a function in your own code the model can choose to call.

Learn more about [function calling](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/function-calling).

Grammar.title: Grammar
Grammar.description: A grammar defined by the user.

ImageGeneration.title: ImageGeneration
ImageGeneration.description: A tool that generates images using a model like `gpt-image-1`.

ImageGenerationCall.title: ImageGenerationCall
ImageGenerationCall.description: An image generation request made by the model.

ImageGenerationInputImageMask.title: ImageGenerationInputImageMask
ImageGenerationInputImageMask.description:
Optional mask for inpainting.

Contains `image_url`
(string, optional) and `file_id` (string, optional).

ItemReference.title: ItemReference
ItemReference.description: An internal identifier for an item to reference.

LocalShell.title: LocalShell
LocalShell.description: A tool that allows the model to execute shell commands in a local environment.

LocalShellCall.title: LocalShellCall
LocalShellCall.description: A tool call to run a command on the local shell.

LocalShellCallAction.title: LocalShellCallAction
LocalShellCallAction.description: Execute a shell command on the server.

LocalShellCallOutput.title: LocalShellCallOutput
LocalShellCallOutput.description: The output of a local shell tool call.

Logprob.title: Logprob
Logprob.description: The log probability of a token.

LogprobTopLogprob.title: LogprobTopLogprob
LogprobTopLogprob.description: The top log probability of a token.

Mcp.title: Mcp
Mcp.description:
Give the model access to additional tools via remote Model Context Protocol
(MCP) servers. [Learn more about MCP](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools-remote-mcp).

McpAllowedToolsMcpToolFilter.title: McpAllowedToolsMcpToolFilter
McpAllowedToolsMcpToolFilter.description: A filter object to specify which tools are allowed.

McpApprovalRequest.title: McpApprovalRequest
McpApprovalRequest.description: A request for human approval of a tool invocation.

McpApprovalResponse.title: McpApprovalResponse
McpApprovalResponse.description: A response to an MCP approval request.

McpCall.title: McpCall
McpCall.description: An invocation of a tool on an MCP server.

McpListTools.title: McpListTools
McpListTools.description: A list of tools available on an MCP server.

McpListToolsTool.title: McpListToolsTool
McpListToolsTool.description: A tool available on an MCP server.

McpRequireApprovalMcpToolApprovalFilter.title: McpRequireApprovalMcpToolApprovalFilter
McpRequireApprovalMcpToolApprovalFilter.description:
Specify which of the MCP server's tools require approval.

Can be
`always`, `never`, or a filter object associated with tools
that require approval.

McpRequireApprovalMcpToolApprovalFilterA.title: McpRequireApprovalMcpToolApprovalFilterAlways
McpRequireApprovalMcpToolApprovalFilterA.description: A filter object to specify which tools are allowed.

McpRequireApprovalMcpToolApprovalFilterN.title: McpRequireApprovalMcpToolApprovalFilterNever
McpRequireApprovalMcpToolApprovalFilterN.description: A filter object to specify which tools are allowed.

OutcomeExit.title: OutcomeExit
OutcomeExit.description: Indicates that the shell commands finished and returned an exit code.

OutcomeTimeout.title: OutcomeTimeout
OutcomeTimeout.description: Indicates that the shell call exceeded its configured time limit.

OutputImage.title: OutputImage
OutputImage.description: The image output from the code interpreter.

OutputLogs.title: OutputLogs
OutputLogs.description: The logs output from the code interpreter.

PendingSafetyCheck.title: PendingSafetyCheck
PendingSafetyCheck.description: A pending safety check for the computer call.

RankingOptionsHybridSearch.title: RankingOptionsHybridSearch
RankingOptionsHybridSearch.description: Weights that control how reciprocal rank fusion balances semantic embedding matches versus sparse keyword matches when hybrid search is enabled.

Reasoning.title: Reasoning
Reasoning.description:
**gpt-5 and o-series models only**

Configuration options for
[reasoning models](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/reasoning).

mm_processor_kwargs.title: Mm Processor Kwargs
mm_processor_kwargs.description: Additional kwargs to pass to the HF processor.

priority.description: The priority of the request (lower means earlier handling; default: 0). Any priority other than 0 will raise an error if the served model does not use priority scheduling.

ResponseCodeInterpreterToolCallParam.description: A tool call to run code.

ResponseCompactionItemParamParam.title: ResponseCompactionItemParamParam
ResponseCompactionItemParamParam.description: A compaction item generated by the [`v1/responses/compact` API](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/responses/compact).

ResponseComputerToolCallOutputScreenshot.title: ResponseComputerToolCallOutputScreenshotParam
ResponseComputerToolCallOutputScreenshot.description: A computer screenshot image used with the computer use tool.

ResponseCustomToolCallOutputParam.title: ResponseCustomToolCallOutputParam

ResponseFormatJSONObject.title: ResponseFormatJSONObject
ResponseFormatJSONObject.description:
JSON object response format.

An older method of generating JSON responses.
Using `json_schema` is recommended for models that support it. Note that the
model will not generate JSON without a system or user message instructing it
to do so.

ResponseFormatText.title: ResponseFormatText
ResponseFormatText.description: Default response format. Used to generate text responses.

ResponseFormatTextJSONSchemaConfig.title: ResponseFormatTextJSONSchemaConfig
ResponseFormatTextJSONSchemaConfig.description:
JSON Schema response format.

Used to generate structured JSON responses.
Learn more about [Structured Outputs](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/structured-outputs).

ResponseFunctionShellCallOutputContentPa.title: ResponseFunctionShellCallOutputContentParam
ResponseFunctionShellCallOutputContentPa.description: Captured stdout and stderr for a portion of a shell tool call output.

ResponseFunctionToolCall.title: ResponseFunctionToolCall
ResponseFunctionToolCall.description:
A tool call to run a function.

See the
[function calling guide](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/function-calling) for more information.

ResponseFunctionToolCallParam.title: ResponseFunctionToolCallParam
ResponseFunctionToolCallParam.description:
A tool call to run a function.

See the
[function calling guide](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/function-calling) for more information.

ResponseFunctionWebSearchParam.title: ResponseFunctionWebSearchParam
ResponseFunctionWebSearchParam.description:

ResponseInputFile.description: A file input to the model.

ResponseInputFileContentParam.description: A file input to the model.

ResponseReasoningItem.title: ResponseReasoningItem
ResponseReasoningItem.description:
A description of the chain of thought used by a reasoning model while generating
a response. Be sure to include these items in your `input` to the Responses API
for subsequent turns of a conversation if you are manually
[managing context](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/conversation-state).

ResponseReasoningItemParam.title: ResponseReasoningItemParam
ResponseReasoningItemParam.description:
A description of the chain of thought used by a reasoning model while generating
a response. Be sure to include these items in your `input` to the Responses API
for subsequent turns of a conversation if you are manually
[managing context](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/conversation-state).

ResponseTextConfig.title: ResponseTextConfig
ResponseTextConfig.description:
Configuration options for a text response from the model.

Can be plain
text or structured JSON data. Learn more:
- [Text inputs and outputs](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/text)
- [Structured Outputs](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/structured-outputs)

request_id.title: Request Id
request_id.description: The request_id related to this request. If the caller does not set it, a random_uuid will be generated. This id is used through out the inference process and return in response.

mm_processor_kwargs.title: Mm Processor Kwargs
mm_processor_kwargs.description: Additional kwargs to pass to the HF processor.

priority.title: Priority
priority.description: The priority of the request (lower means earlier handling; default: 0). Any priority other than 0 will raise an error if the served model does not use priority scheduling.

cache_salt.title: Cache Salt
cache_salt.description: If specified, the prefix cache will be salted with the provided string to prevent an attacker to guess prompts in multi-user environments. The salt should be random, protected from access by 3rd parties, and long enough to be unpredictable (e.g., 43 characters base64-encoded, corresponding to 256 bit). Not supported by vLLM engine V0.

enable_response_messages.title: Enable Response Messages
enable_response_messages.description: Dictates whether or not to return messages as part of the response object. Currently only supported for non-streaming non-background and gpt-oss only.

Role.title: Role
Role.description: The role of a message author (mirrors ``chat::Role``).

ScoreMultiModalParam.title: ScoreMultiModalParam
ScoreMultiModalParam.description:
A specialized parameter type for scoring multimodal content

The reasons why don't reuse `CustomChatCompletionMessageParam` directly:
1. Score tasks don't need the 'role' field (user/assistant/system) that's required in chat completions
2. Including chat-specific fields would confuse users about their purpose in scoring
3. This is a more focused interface that only exposes what's needed for scoring

mm_processor_kwargs.title: Mm Processor Kwargs
mm_processor_kwargs.description: Additional kwargs to pass to the HF processor.

priority.title: Priority
priority.description: The priority of the request (lower means earlier handling; default: 0). Any priority other than 0 will raise an error if the served model does not use priority scheduling.

ShellCall.title: ShellCall
ShellCall.description: A tool representing a request to execute one or more shell commands.

ShellCallAction.title: ShellCallAction
ShellCallAction.description: The shell commands and limits that describe how to run the tool call.

ShellCallOutput.title: ShellCallOutput
ShellCallOutput.description: The streamed output items emitted by a shell tool call.

Summary.title: Summary
Summary.description: A summary text from the model.

add_generation_prompt.title: Add Generation Prompt
add_generation_prompt.description: If true, the generation prompt will be added to the chat template. This is a parameter used by chat template in tokenizer config of the model.

return_token_strs.title: Return Token Strs
return_token_strs.description: If true, also return the token strings corresponding to the token ids.

continue_final_message.title: Continue Final Message
continue_final_message.description: If this is set, the chat will be formatted so that the final message in the chat is open-ended, without any EOS tokens. The model will continue this message rather than starting a new one. This allows you to "prefill" part of the model's response for it. Cannot be used at the same time as `add_generation_prompt`.

add_special_tokens.title: Add Special Tokens
add_special_tokens.description: If true, special tokens (e.g. BOS) will be added to the prompt on top of what is added by the chat template. For most models, the chat template takes care of adding the special tokens so this should be set to false (as is the default).

chat_template.title: Chat Template
chat_template.description: A Jinja template to use for this conversion. As of transformers v4.44, default chat template is no longer allowed, so you must provide a chat template if the tokenizer does not define one.

chat_template_kwargs.title: Chat Template Kwargs
chat_template_kwargs.description: Additional keyword args to pass to the template renderer. Will be accessible by the chat template.

mm_processor_kwargs.title: Mm Processor Kwargs
mm_processor_kwargs.description: Additional kwargs to pass to the HF processor.

tools.title: Tools
tools.description: A list of tools the model may call.

add_special_tokens.title: Add Special Tokens
add_special_tokens.description: If true (the default), special tokens (e.g. BOS) will be added to the prompt.

return_token_strs.title: Return Token Strs
return_token_strs.description: If true, also return the token strings corresponding to the token ids.

ToolChoiceAllowed.title: ToolChoiceAllowed
ToolChoiceAllowed.description: Constrains the tools available to the model to a pre-defined set.

ToolChoiceApplyPatch.title: ToolChoiceApplyPatch
ToolChoiceApplyPatch.description: Forces the model to call the apply_patch tool when executing a tool call.

ToolChoiceCustom.title: ToolChoiceCustom
ToolChoiceCustom.description: Use this option to force the model to call a specific custom tool.

ToolChoiceFunction.title: ToolChoiceFunction
ToolChoiceFunction.description: Use this option to force the model to call a specific function.

ToolChoiceMcp.title: ToolChoiceMcp
ToolChoiceMcp.description: Use this option to force the model to call a specific tool on a remote MCP server.

ToolChoiceShell.title: ToolChoiceShell
ToolChoiceShell.description: Forces the model to call the shell tool when a tool call is required.

ToolChoiceTypes.title: ToolChoiceTypes
ToolChoiceTypes.description:
Indicates that the model should use a built-in tool to generate a response.
[Learn more about built-in tools](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools).

vllm_xargs.title: Vllm Xargs
vllm_xargs.description: Additional request parameters with string or numeric values, used by custom extensions.

WebSearchPreviewTool.title: WebSearchPreviewTool
WebSearchPreviewTool.description:
This tool searches the web for relevant results to use in a response.

Learn more about the [web search tool](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools-web-search).

WebSearchTool.title: WebSearchTool
WebSearchTool.description:
Search the Internet for sources related to the prompt.

Learn more about the
[web search tool](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools-web-search).

openai__types__responses__response_input.title: Message
openai__types__responses__response_input.description:
A message input to the model with a role indicating instruction following
hierarchy. Instructions given with the `developer` or `system` role take
precedence over instructions given with the `user` role.

openai__types__responses__web_search_too.title: UserLocation
openai__types__responses__web_search_too.description: The approximate location of the user.
